security: This document discusses the relationship between a British newsman (RETTIE), a woman (LICOOKY-1), and their connections to individuals of interest. Revealing these relationships and the fact that RETTIE is potentially 'in pay [of a] secret service' could compromise intelligence sources and methods. The mention of attempting contact with Mario Fonteforte Toledo also highlights active intelligence operations. Quoting directly: 'RETTIE, BRITISH B.B.C. NEWSMAN, WHO IN PAY SECRET SERVICE IN CONTACT LICOOKY-1...RETTIE TRYING MAKE CONTACT WITH MARIO FONTEFORTE TOLEDO.'
summary: A CIA message from Mexico City reports on the relationship between a British BBC newsman, RETTIE, and a woman, LICOOKY-1, noting RETTIE's possible ties to a secret service and attempts to contact Mario Fonteforte Toledo.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET-classified message, dated January 24, 1963, originates from the CIA station in Mexico City and addresses the Director concerning the relationship between RETTIE, a British BBC newsman, and LICOOKY-1. The message indicates that RETTIE may be associated with a secret service and is in contact with LICOOKY-1, who is described as intelligent, non-Communist, and close to Juan Jose Arevalo. RETTIE is also reportedly attempting to make contact with Mario Fonteforte Toledo, and the station is aware of the RETTIE-LICOOKY-1 relationship through LICOOKY-1.
title: Report on RETTIE and LICOOKY-1 Relationship
